Congratulations, Mrs. Thurner!

South Park Elementary Center art teacher Ms. Bersamina and her fourth grade gifted students have spent part of their first week back from winter break creating joey kangaroo pouches to send to Australia following the devastating wildfires. The students followed material and size guidelines set by the Animal Rescue Craft Guild and created patterns of different sizes, cut the fabric, and helped to organize the materials. Ms. Bersamina sewed all of the pieces together to make the pouches. There were 112 pouches in all, which is enough for 56 animals! They range in size from XXS to XXL. Other elementary center students were involved by creating paper hearts with thoughts of encouragement to go inside the pouches. The pouches will be distributed across Australia to various wildlife rescue organizations. Ms. Bersamina and her students plan to continue making and sending pouches for as long as they are needed.
